name: Trytebeats music of a trinary cpu

metadata.name: Trytebeats Î¸
metadata.description:
Read more on the [Trytebeats medium article](https://dadabots.medium.com/trytebeats-music-of-a-trinary-cpu-f95546295bd3) 

ðŸŽ¶ 

What does a trinary computer sound like? Threes all the way down.

Trytebeats is a program for a trinary (aka ternary) computer. It generates music using tritwise operators.

You're hearing powers of three on all scales of the waveform- the timbre, the melody, the harmony, the rhythm, the riffs, and the composition.

ðŸŽ¶ 

Trytebeat Î¸'s program is short and beautiful. I increment t, at a sample rate 3402 Hz, with 4-trit quantization:

```(t*((tÎ¸(((t>>10)+2)%3%2)*2)>>6))&(t&(tÎ¸2)>>5)%81```

Thatâ€™s it. The code seems tiny, yet it blossoms into emergent sonic-visual complexity.

ðŸŽ¶ 

This series is the birth of Trytebeats.

Collector can claim an animated lenticular print of their Trytebeat shipped free. They look like [these](https://twitter.com/dadabots/status/1430136875524804624?s=20) ðŸ¥³ 

Collector also gets hifi video and future airdrop (see article)
